intro: Gratiola mexicana, commonly known as Mexican yellowroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, which include anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Gratiola mexicana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
